result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Chastity Michelle Adams
Current: 740 E 24th Street, C/O LTWP Chastity Adams, Minneapolis, MN 55404 United States  (Effective: 06-23-2022)
Prior: 740 E 24th Street, C/O LTPW Chastity Adams, Minneapolis, MN 55404 United States

** AMENDED**
Includes 22CM7, 22CM25, and 22CM26.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Defendant must comply with the Deferred Judgment of Conviction signed 06/23/22. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Shawn A..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

11:00 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Holly Elkin Rockow, DF ATTY: John P Bjork appeared via zoom, DF: Chastity Michelle Adams appeared via zoom. Includes 22CM7, 22CM25, and 22CM26. Court reviews case. Court states zoom appearance was approved if a waiver of personal appearance was filed. Atty Bjork states did not file a waiver of personal appearance but has advised DE of rights to appear in person. Court addresses DE re: Waiver of personal appearance. Court appoves zoom appearance. ADA Rockow recites resolution. Court reviews COMPAS assessment completed. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to Case 22CM7 Count 1: Disorderly Conduct- 947.01(1) to 1 year DJOC. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Case 22CM25 and 22CM26. Sentencing arguments.  Court Amends Bond. Clerk to mail bond. 

Court Orders: 22CM7 Count 1: 1 year DJOC

Adjourned at 11:18 AM
Filed by Atty Bjork. arc
COMPAS Assessment. To rg for EFV's review. hml
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court reviews case. Atty Bjork states there has been some discussion regarding resolution and requests to set PLEA. ADA Rockow states resolution is DJOC. Court approves zoom appearance as long as waiver of personal appearance is filed. ADA Rockow to orginize COMPAS to be completed with DE. Court sets PLEAS. Adjourned 01:12 PM  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least TWO times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Shawn A. or his residence.
